website_summaries.verdict: A tough little cart that will satisfy the vast majority, but check those dimensions.
pros: We doubt you'd find a robust, 400-pound capacity cart for less
cons: Requires assembly, and the instructions are poor

customer_reviews.title: Life improving purchase
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews, I was nervous that I would receive a crappy quality wagon that would be too hard to put together. ....I dont know what the fuss is about. It took me longer to yell at my husband to find the tools that he didnt put away then it did for me to put this wagon together. Less than 2 mins to put everything on, and 10 mins to find two wrenches. While it is not the heaviest duty wagon, it'll be fine for my use. It's worth the price. If you need a wagon for frequent heavy loads- spend the money on a real one.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Rust bucket!
customer_reviews.text: I got this cart as the perfect way to move things about my property. Less than two weeks after assembly and its rusting out all over.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Scott

customer_reviews.title: The comments about the poor instructions are spot on
customer_reviews.text: I bought it and think it will serve me well. The comments about the poor instructions are spot on, but the reality is there are very few pieces that need to be put together and I figured it out. The key thing is to have a 7/8th inch wrench or a good adjustable wrench for the bottom parts. No tools come with the package, and that's fine. It was $62 for me. I ordered it on Sunday and got it on Wednesday for and with Amazon Prime I didn't pay anything more to ship a 40-pound package to my house.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W.

customer_reviews.title: Overall Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: Bad craftsmanship does not allow side panels to align and operate properly for opening sides and lock-down of sides as advertised. Base cotter pins have to be removed to be able to put sides up or down then secured with lock down flip pins. Lock downs are not usable as sides do not align properly for tension. Side panels do not fit on square and are too short for flip pins to catch in corner receptacles. Mine was delivered with simple missing parts, ie, handle nut and washer. Overall bad design. The smell is the least of your problems--that can air out outside.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: GOOD CART FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This is JUST what I needed! The reviews were right about the tires, they stink at first, all the way through the box! So I kept it outside until I put it together. After a few days the smell seems to have dissipated. I really was worried at first because come winter I'll be using this to carry wood in to the house. Seems pretty well made, good enough for around the homestead anyway. Those big (stinky) tires roll over EVERYTHING with ease. I like that the sides & ends can drop down to load/unload stuff. All in all I'd say THIS one is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: G. P. C.

customer_reviews.title: A nice sturdy garden wagon
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I took off a star was because the first one I received had a cross-threaded bolt at a major assembly point, that would not accept the nut. It was a Christmas gift that arrived in November, and I didn't get around to trying to assemble until January. I was concerned about getting a return, but the vendor immediately sent out a replacement even though it had been just short of 60 days. Kudos. The second one was perfect. It took about 10 minutes to assemble alone. It is sturdy and works great. I have lent it to neighbors to use and all have been impressed. Very pleased with the product, and how they reacted in customer service.
customer_reviews.author: jmace57

customer_reviews.title: Distaster!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that I could not get the holes lined up to facilitate final assemble at the top of each corner front and back. even more frustrating is Amazon's answer for this complaint is to get in touch when the manufactory . The manufactory "Sandusky" tells me to get back in touch with Amazon. I tried to do this but the prompt kept sending to back to where I had already been "Sandusky" . numerous attempts to get in touch with Amazon proved to be fruitless. gave me a smoldering head ach. sturdiness seemed ok beyond that could not use this. could also see a welding knot on the edge of one of either the front /rear panels.
customer_reviews.author: BILL SMITH

customer_reviews.title: If I wanted to BUILD a wagon...
customer_reviews.text: If I wanted to BUILD a wagon, I'd weld together a frame and just order some wheels. I don't want to go to the trouble, so I order a wagon. You know, so I DON'T HAVE TO GOD DAMN BUILD ONE. So what do I get? A mess of metal bits, a bunch of bolts, and the usual crappy instructions. (sigh) I might as well throw this junk on the scrap heap and go build my own after all. At least that way I won't have to figure out somebody else's moronic design.
customer_reviews.author: David Roland Cantor

customer_reviews.title: Convertible Style!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! I have wanted one for a while and it is great. I don't have a big yard but moving supplies and equipment can be time consuming so this cart is just what I needed. Love how easily the sides can be raised, lowered or removed. Other reviewers are correct it doesn't say what tools you will need to assemble and they could have been clearer but overall I was able to figure it out with some trial and error. Socket wrench, screwdriver were needed so make sure you have those on hand. I would recommend it as the cons are outweighed by the pros.
customer_reviews.author: Pure Prarie

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We've added baked goods and jams to our fruit and vegetable stand this year, so suddenly I'm hauling twice as much product back and forth three days a week. Ken could manage his part (the produce) because he's a big strong guy. But I was getting discouraged at my end -- it's just too much to handle by box or hand truck. So I bought this wagon. It's a great price, it was easy to put together and it is just perfect for hauling stuff across uneven ground. I've been using it for five weeks and haven't had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy B

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but cheap materials...
customer_reviews.text: This thing felt very premium when I was building it, but real-world usage has started to show some flaws. The metal is pretty flimsy, and just assembling/disassembling the cart has lead to bends in the attachment points. It's also disappointing that you can't lay the "walls" flat to give yourself an extended flatbed cart (there are competing designs on Amazon that allow this, and they seem like a way better choice). The way the walls lock into each other on this cart, you're kind of limited to all walls up or no walls at all. That said, it rolls like a dream and maneuvers very well. I just wish more thought was put into the design of the cage itself.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Stolz

customer_reviews.title: Even in the box the tires smell terrible. AND the drop down sides rub against the ...
customer_reviews.text: This would be 5 stars EXCEPT, the tires STINK. I had this in a spare bedroom before assembly, BIG MISTAKE. Even in the box the tires smell terrible. AND the drop down sides rub against the tires after assembly. I'll add some type of spacer to fix that. Yes, the cotter pins are rather thin, but I'm sure they'll last with no problem. So, the cart is now in our detached garage and I anticipate a lot of good use out of this hauler. ALSO, assembly is very easy, even without reading the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hale

customer_reviews.title: The wagon is great, the tires not so much
customer_reviews.text: I have had my wagon for two years, ordered from Amazon Prime in Feb 2018. The wagon is perfect: very sturdy, easy to assembly, handles heavy loads well. The only issue I have is that the tires lasted only 2 years....They seem to have dry rotted and actually have holes in them. I bought some solid rubber utility cart tires / wheels from Harbor Freight for 6.99 each today, am thinking I'll get a lot more usage from those than the ones that came on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra P. Hays

customer_reviews.title: use
customer_reviews.text: i have used this to move all kinds of furniture into my new apartment, move groceries, take out trash, take laundry to laundry building in my housing complex. i hold a lot of weight. rocker recliners, lots of storage bins at one time and very easy to pull. Just understand if you have issues putting up the sides. it may take a while as in weeks before all will fit together due to being tight.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFRA JONES

customer_reviews.title: Best investment we have made on yard equipment in years
customer_reviews.text: This wagon has saved our backs and arms many times over. Our yard is not huge, less than an acre, but we love it and work hard to maintain it.. We have many large trees which means bags and bags of leaves that must be carried to the curb for pickup. Branches. bags of grass all have to be moved a great distance many times up a hill. We have used this guy for two seasons now and have loved it. The 'tail gate' can even drop down to allow for longer items to be carried. Sturdy, well made, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cinema Fan

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good! Wish I would have bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved today and pur together myself in under 1/2 hour. Loaded up firewood and brought to the backdoor immediately. So nice to do it all in one trip and then go back to the woodpile, fill it again and leave it by the backdoor for backup wood. I'm nervous about rust as I plan on using this outdoors all winter, perhaps I'll have to get a tarp for it! Wish I would have bought this sooner - so does my back!
customer_reviews.author: Pat A

customer_reviews.title: A useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one years ago. I can't believe how useful I find it, how did I manage to move cut branches, whole plants and tools around in the garden before I got this? I haul a full trunk of groceries into the house, instead of 4 or 5 trips from the garage to the kitchen at the far side of the house. My only criticism is the sides could be a little sturdier. At this price though, I an not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: D. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Product good for flat tire.
customer_reviews.text: Product is very good except for the fact that one of the wheels had a hole in the tube and would not hold air. The other three were fine. I chose to order and install a new tube at my expense. This was not an easy job, but it is ok and ready for use now. I would say that the manufacturer needs to watch their quality control. The average consumer probably could not have changed this tube, and would have needed to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: C. N. Whilden Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Hinge was welded in the wrong position
customer_reviews.text: One of the hinges on side wall was welded in an incorrect position. It was off by nearly 1/2 inch as compared to the other side, this made it impossible to attach one wall to the base. The paint job was below average and there was already visible rust on some part. Past all of that, some of the hard was just tossed loosely into the box. I got a complete set but I bet it falls out from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: D EVANS

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This wagon is simply amazing! I bought it for several reasons. I have a dog that can't walk but can ride in this wagon. I can use it to garden... Put a 5 gallon bucket inside, load it with tomatoes and other vegetables and get it up to the house easy. Very versatile and the tires are also amazing even for going up and down curbs. I would buy this if I had small children rather than a "kids wagon" because it sturdier and the sides come down so you could even use it to sit on at a parade!
customer_reviews.author: Jen A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy With Very Cool Tires
customer_reviews.text: I love this cart! It is perfect for my intended primary use which is to haul wood from my wood pile to my porch where I can unload it for use in my wood stove. I know I will also find many other great uses for it around my 40 acre kingdom. The installation is a bit tricky I found as the photos in the guide are hard to correlate to the reality of the parts but with patience I got er’ done. The cart is sturdy and I really like the ATV like real air tires.
customer_reviews.author: Brad L. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: I love this utility cart
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I love this utility cart! It's good quality, sturdy, and it has been easy to maneuver. The directions are a bit vague, but you shouldn't have a problem if you look closely at the pictures and follow along. Look at me.. I'm a woman, and I got it done in about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: hard to get front wheels on
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together until I got to the front wheels, then it started, the holes for the cotter pins was drilled to close to wheel, so the wheel would not fit with a washer on it. so I just used a small nail for cotter pin. Think it will serve my needs, just for yard work. Also the tires are rated for 300 lb. on this 400 lb. load capacity wagon, something is not right.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cart --- Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cart --- Just what I needed. Easy to assemble took less that 30min. really did not need the instruction but they were fine except one picture showed hole in the wrong place but did not matter. Yes the tires do smell. I thought that when the dog smelled the tires he might get ,,,, no way but they smell real bad. Hauled my first load a bag of rocks across the yard over big Douglas fir roots and lumps and bumps. It did the job and I am happy. I am 75 and no more wheel barrow to balance for me you can call me CartMan now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heinz

customer_reviews.title: Fun, versatile toy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I found it very easy to assemble, done in 10 minutes! Partially thanks to the reviews I read on here that explained about the little cotter pins for the wheels. I've always wanted one of these utility wagons and I'm glad I got this one. Now that we have a fire pit and a big yard, it's great for hauling fire wood and plants and bags of soil.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Berger

customer_reviews.title: A SNAP to put together. I saw the reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: A SNAP to put together. I saw the reviews saying it was difficult to assemble, so I was afraid to purchase it. I'm here to tell you I just assembled it & it was a SNAP. Most all the parts were pre-assembled & you just had to add a part & tighten the screws. This is a DANDY CART. Well constructed & strong enough to hold heavy loads.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Great Yard Cart
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, with what seems to be a thick coat of paint. Inflatable tires. Easy to pull. Bought this to collect wood that has fallen from our many trees. Rides high enough that there a no issues pulling it over our sometimes uneven back yard, even with a load of deadfall inside. Rolls smoothly enough that I can pull it right up the steps into our shed. Took us a while to figure out how to put the sides on so that they were square & could also be easily dropped down if needed, but once we did, we found everything lined up without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joan B.

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the money
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to assemble, but not bad. Check the part sheet to make sure you put the right parts in the right place. Tiers need to be refilled monthly. Over all, my wife loves it in her garden and I use it to transfer material from the car to the house or project. My daughter Loves riding in it... CJ
customer_reviews.author: CJ Larsen

customer_reviews.title: I would have been very satisfied with this cart
customer_reviews.text: I would have been very satisfied with this cart; however after it was assembled, we realized it was noticeably unlevel. One of the back wheels did not touch the ground. Decided to keep cart since it was already assembled. One of the axles in the frame was welded too high. Otherwise a great cart.
customer_reviews.author: ctsl

customer_reviews.title: Not hard to put together if you are somewhat mechanically ...
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to put together if you are somewhat mechanically inclined. Had to purchase four washers for the wheels (a bit more heavy duty than the three that were included) since we had already used the three washers that were packed for the framing brackets. Unpack carefully as there is a loose bolt and nut that you will use to attach the handle. We were able to do all this work outside so the heavy odor from the tires and the packaging was not oppressive, and by the next day there was no odor at all.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It's rated for 400 pounds I am not sure I would test that. To Improve this simple increase the length of the "neck" of the handle from the cart to where the handle is attached but a couple of inches and it would increase the turn radius a lot!!! Second Provide some sort of straps that would allow the sides to be lowered but stop them from dragging on the wheels. And not green.
customer_reviews.author: UGF

customer_reviews.title: Gift for son, good but really smells
customer_reviews.text: When I got the package in the mail, the smell took over my home and it was still in the package and gift wrapped. When my son put it together he said the smell was really bad too. It seems to be pretty sturdy, it holds a lot, but 400 pounds? Not too sure about that. But overall, he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: cindles1987

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect parts to assemble correctly
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box everything seam in order but as I started to assemble I noticed it had 2 front axles,I needed this for the weekend so I had to drill the other front axle to fit the back.Over all the product feels cheap,And if I would of did my homework more it was made in CHINA I do not like buying anything from China.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts in package, poor directions, still decent cart
customer_reviews.text: Assembly directions aren't great and the bag that had the hardware in it was already open with bits missing. We had to drive into town for parts so we could finish assembling the cart. Overall, it's a good cart for our purposes and the price was good, but it was annoying that we had to buy parts so we could finish putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for moving heavy items.  Terrible for people with sensitive sense of smell.
customer_reviews.text: This cart is perfect for anything heavy and I love that the sides fold down. The biggest issue is that it smells horrible. The tires put off a strong rubber smell that we can't get rid of. Because it smells so bad, we have to keep it outside. Now it's rusting from all of the rain. For anyone who is sensitive to smells, this is not the cart for you!
customer_reviews.author: Juniormint73

customer_reviews.title: Lot of useful applications for this thing. Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to move wood from my wood rack to my firepit and fireplace. I also have used this for my ice chest when going to the park and beach, it's solid and hppy with the purchase. I've also put a blanket down and carried my nephew and niece around the block. Overall, im happy
customer_reviews.author: TEO

customer_reviews.title: Need betterf assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Nice wagon. I cut and painted a piece of plywood for the inside steel mesh bottom to spread the load, not sure I trust the bottom mesh not to bend when throwing in rocks, bricks, etc. Really well thought out design for sides and ends, but it took me awhile to put them on correctly, put them on backwards first time, instructions not very clear.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, rolls nicely, sides fit loosely
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty sturdy wagon. The materials seem up to snuff. The only reason I gave it 4 our of 5 stars is that I had a small degree of difficulty mounting the sides on top of the platform and hooking them together. They don't seem to fit together well and the bolts at the top holding the sides together will require a wrench to loosen before a side can be let down to hang beside the cart. Other than that - its well worth ~$65 to me. Wagon rolls nicely and seem solid otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Product was damaged but fixable
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived damaged. I was unaware that one side of the base of the cart was damaged which made it not aline for the pin to go into it. Had to use a hammer and bend the piece back to correct position that side does not fold down as smoothly. Other than that it’s a nice cart
customer_reviews.author: Casey Robertshaw

customer_reviews.title: It works and easiest thing I have ever assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Great wagon. I'm a big guy so it looks funny next to me, but its definitely going to help me with this years garden and keep the load of my bad back from army injuries. Only 4 stars because in the pictures it shows the front adjustable railing with a slot for the steering and in the box I received 2 back railings. You are essentially just paying for the tires. Best set of tires on amazon though if you are too lazy to go to the local Hardware Department store. It is also extremely easy to assemble lol I dont know why people are complaining it even comes with assembly pictures which; I didn't have to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and moves quite effortlessly over my very rough terrain. I read that assembly was difficult so i ignored the written instructions and just looked at the exploded view diagram. It was a piece of cake. I should have purchased one of these a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: MV Weber

customer_reviews.title: It's very sturdy, tall enough so she doesn't have to bend ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to help with her charity work with the Denver homeless. She loves it. It's very sturdy, tall enough so she doesn't have to bend over to pull it, great size, has good and very quiet movement. Update. The wheel cotter pins fell out when first used. So beware you'll need to deal with that. Otherwise, it's a great wagon and definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: putwoman

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable garden cart.
customer_reviews.text: This garden cart was used to transport a garbage can full of water for me to water my garden. I could just use a hose, however I do like to have the clorine vapor off before I water my vegatables . Maybe it doesn't make much differnce, but that's how I garden.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Jay

customer_reviews.title: It's AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect! I bought it to put my portable A/C on so that I could drain it more easily during those humid days as its drain is so close to the ground, the only thing you can put under it is a cookie sheet which would not hold a quart and a half of liquid. I am on the 4th floor of my apt. building and next year it's going to double as a cart for me to take my BBQ stuff outside and back inside when done.
customer_reviews.author: Annaliese

customer_reviews.title: It Lasts
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours for 3 years. It is outside all the time. It still looks new. We use it for all kinds of things. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: violee

customer_reviews.title: Does what i need it to
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I got it for holds a cooler and bait bucket and tackel box to make shore fishing a little easier. Going to add some rod holders. Used it to move a couple cords of unsplit wood worked great and held the weight. Caution to putting it together inside the house. The tires have a very strong smell went away with some air freshener I have had the cart a couple of months now and keep it in my shed I no longer notice any smell
customer_reviews.author: Dimmelus

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect and parts missing
customer_reviews.text: I decided to keep because my needs for this are minimal. Front axle had manufacturing defect that made it crooked and one wheel won’t touch ground. It pulls ok with 3 wheels to move my planters around. Lock nuts were not included so had to go to HD to buy some so these issues complicated assembly If it hadn’t been so bulky a return I probably would have done so
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Good?better?no,Best!
customer_reviews.text: !st, I was blown away at the ease of assembly. all the tools needed were 2 wrenches and a screwdriver. the frame, floor and walls are quite sturdy. I'm using it to hall groceries and help around the garden. Expecting to get many years of service. it's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: squiqwe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable for our purpose
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a wagon to hold a spray tank that I take around our property to spray weeds. It seems durable and sturdy for our purpose, and pulls well. And as long as you don't pull to the side too sharply it stays on track and doesn't tip. Overall it works for us.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Buy elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest piece of garbage I have ever seen! It doesn't sit level, parts were missing, the sides don't fit together or fold down like it shows. I ordered this because I have back problems and needed something to help me when I needed to move things and the ONLY thing keeping me from sending it back for a refund it that I am unable to take it apart after having to fight with it to get it together.The cart I received is also not the cart shown.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Wagon!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble and fantastic for my yard work. I can hall plants, bags of mulch, and other bulky hard to handle items. I especially like that I can drop any or all of the 4 sides for ease of removing items. I have also used it to sit in while I work on my raised beds. My grandkids love to ride in it too. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: As soon as you get this you should spray with ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as you get this you should spray with a rust preventer paint as there is no coating in the tracks that hold the wire in other than that it is great
customer_reviews.author: Bradford Schultze

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Amazon cart at our door.
customer_reviews.text: We use to move various hefty items, if we have big stuff arriving its sits by our door behind a bush so drivers can set it on it easily. The sides fold down so anything fits on it. Its nice looking and doesnt leave marks. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BigSteel

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't order again!
customer_reviews.text: It had several bent areas that seemed to be from shipping, or due to poor packaging. My husband spent about 40 minutes fixing it and the back pops open unexpectedly when something presses against it while pulling it. I expected a better product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: MzV

customer_reviews.title: Sandusky Lee CW3418
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. It took 30 minutes to put together. When you open the box you need to be careful not to lose the parts. You have to air up the tires that's normal and they smell like new tires that's normal. It takes tools to put it together that's normal. 4 stars because it should be packed better for the small nuts and washers would not be lost. And the welds could be better.
customer_reviews.author: MP 951

customer_reviews.title: Good wagon
customer_reviews.text: Although we are happy with the wagon I thought the sides folded down so you could lock them in place for upside down transport, this is not the case. I made some simple changes to facilitate easier transport, first I put easily removable pins in the wheel axles, second I put a linchpin on the handle. It now comes apart quickly and is very compact for putting in our car. We've used it several times now.
customer_reviews.author: Code 80

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about this. I was planning on using it in the quarantine boozy mom social distancing parade, but it appears to be missing parts to assemble. The instructions say use all these screws that arent there. Not put together it looks pretty sturdy though
customer_reviews.author: Wotnart

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for my use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lighter cart to haul trash cans. I haul two of the rubber/plastic cans filled with trimmings from the back of a large yard. It's not heavy duty (rugged) enough for hauling heavy stuff and if left out in the weather I can see it rusting pretty fast. Good price for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: sdjlc

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have your tools ready.
customer_reviews.text: Ths cart was easy to assemble once I found all of the correct size wrenches for assembly. You will also need pliers and a flathead screwdriver. I was glad to have the information on the cotter pins from previous reviews.
customer_reviews.author: paintedlady

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it! No more running back and forth for tools, or sprinkler parts, or pots, or soil, you name it, he's happy to have this. It holds a lot of weight and sides can be lowered too.
customer_reviews.author: kgprice

customer_reviews.title: excellent, well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a two-phase review. The first is about the cart itself...excellent, well made, easy to maneuver. The second phase concerns the assembly instructions. POOR, POOR, POOR! No manual, just a small pamphlet with absolutely useless diagrams! Their exploded views are so small one needs a magnifying glass, and even then they are totally inadequate. What a shame that such a fine product comes with two pages of useless assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Myron Bonnell

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: Unable to put together as axle for one of wheel was 5mm (.5 cm) too short. Pictures attached show difference. After 1 hour of constructing then 1 hour deconstructing to put back in the box for return and taking for return, it was not worth replacing with an unknown quality unit. I will find another with better construction and value.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Gipson

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING STINKS!!! My entire garage reeks ...
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING STINKS!!! My entire garage reeks to high heaven. Not sure if I want to open the box or just have UPS come pick it up and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: RR Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: Over all it's a fairly nice utility wagon
customer_reviews.text: There was some kind of dark sandy grit in the packing box, yet the packaging while damaged was sufficient to protect the contents. The tires, one of which was flat gave off a strong chemical odor, which I hope will go away over time. Some of the spot welds holding the wire mesh to the bottom cross bars were off leaving a loose spot. Other than that it came with decent instructions and all the necessary parts to assemble it in a blister pack. Over all it's a fairly nice utility wagon, I would have given it a higher rating if the spot welds were on the mesh and the tires didn't stink as badly as they did.
customer_reviews.author: gerald c.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews were true about the smelly tires. I left it in my front porch for about a week and the smell is gone. it went together a little strangely but it works great got moving manure, potting soil and garden tools around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pictures dont match the product I was sold. The pictures dont even match each other online.
customer_reviews.text: Not as pictured. Asked the question before I ordered this, "Is the front where the handle hits the wagon door bent to fit the handle as pictured in the other 4 pictures online or as pictured in the first pic online. I was told it has a bend in it, It did not.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua N.

customer_reviews.title: This wagon works nicely but I would have preferred larger tires that would ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to sit on to work in my garden after having surgery. This wagon works nicely but I would have preferred larger tires that would make it easier to stand up. I'm sure I'll put it to work in the yard this next spring. It's a nice size to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Winchester Retiree

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my garden
customer_reviews.text: I like the big wheels. It makes it easy to move stuff around. It holds a lot of stuff. I like it a lot. It was not too hard to put together, but I had to slow down and think about what i was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great help around the house
customer_reviews.text: Every homeowner should have a strong all terrain wagon. Moving materials, garbage, hauling cooler, painting supplies, planting flowers, and anything else you would normally carry fits in or on the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at this and thinking about buying it for over a year. I’m not sure why I delayed! I have used it to haul heavy boxes back to storage, firewood up to the house, and a big load down to the dumpster. When the weather warms up and spring gets here I will be using it constantly in gardening.
customer_reviews.author: TX BEL

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart
customer_reviews.text: Mine lost a pin holding the wheel on the first day. The company could give you extra in the box it seems. I had to order more pins to fix. They are hard to get on. Otherwise the cart is fine
customer_reviews.author: Preschool teacher

customer_reviews.title: Buy a tube sealant to preserve your tires.
customer_reviews.text: One of the tires won't stay inflated. I have not put more than 2 deep cycle batteries. Per load. I only bought this for light work. I don't plan on using it for more than 1/2 the max workload. This is ridiculous. Was offered a refund or replacement. Decided to fix the tire. Didn't want to take the time. Bought Slime tube sealant. It's back to working great. I'm happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shelene

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cart to assist me with picking up branches, pine cones and straw in my yard. It is great for this purpose. The cart itself was easy to put together. I love the hard wired surface and I expect it to last a while. I needed a wrench that I didn't have and I had to purchase. For the price this works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Evie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and maneuverable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cart so I could transport watering cans and garden tools to various gardens across my 1 acre property. Works perfectly over uneven ground and holds everything I need to water, weed and trim.
customer_reviews.author: dogatty

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: This has been a tremendous back saver. I am so glad I bought it. I have not had any problem with it rusting as others have mentioned. I leave it outside all the time. It is surprisingly sturdy for its size and maneuvers easily.
customer_reviews.author: e. s.

customer_reviews.title: Took about 10 days to arrive!!!!
customer_reviews.text: But the wait was worth it. The assembly was not very difficult even for me. Works great and was just what I was looking for. Use in the yard and bring groceries into the garage and anything else I can imagine. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace Sauby

customer_reviews.title: received  with a flat tire
customer_reviews.text: I have contacted the seller and hope to hear from them soon about the flat tire on my purchase. Not happy at the moment but the buggy is sound and will suit my needs once it is rolling on four tires.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Whisenant

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. If your wheels don't fall off it rusts quick.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an upcoming beach vacation. Assembled at home. Just minor shifting in the garage and two wheels came off before trip. Only pins hold the tires on. Second day at the beach the cart is already visibly rusting around the edges. Lost two pins going 30 feet to the beach by the second day we gave up on it. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT yard wagon
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT yard wagon! It's larger and sturdier that I expected, very easy to pull and bigger tires than I expected! It took me about 45 minutes to put together, but I took my time and triple checked everything. The directions are well written with great diagrams. Some reviewers said the directions were too small. Perhaps that has been remedied, since I'm a 72 year-old woman and had no problem with the print size.
customer_reviews.author: NSF

customer_reviews.title: Little Green Wagon
customer_reviews.text: I really like my little green wagon. I found it kind of hard to put together, but I got it in the end. Will use it in my yard after we get rid of this white stuff. I do alot of yard work and feel this will help.
customer_reviews.author: LJC

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart
customer_reviews.text: It didn't take long to snap together BUT one of the metal slats on bottom is broke. I'm not returning I dont think bbn itll affect the performance and I noticed After assembled
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Good for lite and fairly heavy work.
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger wagon just like it, that I use a lot , and like very much. I wanted a smaller one for smaller jobs. I’m happy with it. I use it for yard and garden work, also just to move stuff around.
customer_reviews.author: James Phillips

customer_reviews.title: very versatile
customer_reviews.text: We have a large yard so this wagon is used for a variety of purposes. If I need to carry plants or mulch to the back yard, i am able to haul it easily to the back yard. If I need to carry dirt, I place two or three 5 gallon buckets in the wagon and off I go. Works far better than a wheelbarrow.
customer_reviews.author: DB-Opusone

customer_reviews.title: Handy item for loads
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a mother's birthday present since she had a cart with plastic wheels and was more like dragging across grass. She test drove it across the grass and the wheels did great and also helps her get grocery items in the house with one trip and does not mess up her floots.
customer_reviews.author: Commdrdave

customer_reviews.title: Allows good grip but makes slender band at belly
customer_reviews.text: I used this to move my dog as she has gone lame in her back legs. She weighs 75pounds and it's hard to get her around. I also intend to use this to move things around the house such as mulch. Very nice wagon. It took a little time to put together but not so long that I doubted it would happen. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: This wagon is a great buy!! It’s the same wagon I found at Lowe’s but cheaper and it’s shipped right to you’re door with all the parts!! Very simple to put together and extremely sturdy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cart
customer_reviews.text: A fabulous little cart! I use it for grocery shopping so I don't have to use a cart, bags, or carry anything to my dorm room and it is so convenient! I've received countless compliments on how it is such a good idea and many inquirerys as to where I got it. It is also excellent for doing my laundry with. Amazing price for how sturdy and good quality it is.
customer_reviews.author: Thrackerzod

customer_reviews.title: Okay it it didn’t come broke
customer_reviews.text: The cart came damaged when it was shipped. One of the tires had a hole in the inner tube. I would of sent it back if I hadn’t put it together before noticing the tire had a hole. The cart also seems very flimsy. Gonna try a gorilla cart next. Wish me luck
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wished got it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this cart. I do heavy lifting and carrying stuff and this helps with it. It clears the steps out of garage easily with large wheels and easy to maneuver on grass and hills.
customer_reviews.author: Baba

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy garden wagon!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for carrying wood in for my wood stove. It saves time and energy and is perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for music festivals.
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart. SUch a life saver for music festivals, couch moves, nephew rides, yard cart and a jillion other uses. It is weird to put the sides on the first time but once you figure it out this thing works pretty well. I took it to the String Summit this last year and helped people take their stuff back to the car. It was awesome
customer_reviews.author: Russ Mann

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great wagon, easy to assemble. Bought as a gardening gift for my roommate. Would have given 5 stars but one of the tires is flat. You'd think that for 80 dollars the equipment would be in good condition!
customer_reviews.author: Livin in Oblivion

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this Headache!
customer_reviews.text: I just spent in excess of 1 hour repacking this to return it to Amazon. Quality control seems to be nonexistent, the side clasp on one side was machined improperly and was too small to allow the clasp to hook rendering the side wall unusable. On top of the defective piece, the directions were unfathomable and contained numerous typos like washwer for washer. There seemed to be no attention to detail from the actual wagon to the instructions. I would never buy a product like this again without seeing the model fully assembled first.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Makes heavy hauling a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart. Great deal for the price and was simple to assemble. Very sturdy and easily maneuvers while hauling heavy loads. I am wondering how I survived without it. And yes, the wheels smell like rubber, but people, it is an OUTDOOR product and the smell quickly fades. I highly recommend this product and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Photos of assembly manual for those who didn't receive one.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this wagon is good quality. I was able to pull 100 lbs of chicken feed over rough terrain with no problems. The issue I had was with the instructions, it was difficult to tell where the washers were to go, and how the cotter pins needed to be bent (I googled 'how to properly install cotter pins'). Some other reviewers said they received tools - no tools were included in my package.
customer_reviews.author: Hellion

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was easy, but DO NOT keep it in a closed space. The tire material off gasses real bad. We put it together in the garage and they smell like a leaking aerosol can. Even outside you can smell it for a week. It's been over a month baking in the 110' sun and now it does not smell.
customer_reviews.author: Coreburner

customer_reviews.title: Super nice garden cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart is very easy to assemble, had to pump up the tires which are pretty beefy, the cart looks and feels sturdy and I am anxious to use it in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: jenne

customer_reviews.title: VERY light duty.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy enough to assemble and adequate if you're moving potted plants from the SUV to back yard but If you're moving any significant weight it's extremely flimsy. I finally took the fold down sides of and put a wooden deck on top of the frame. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Sand in the package and on the parts.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Sand in the package and on the parts... very inconvenient when opening the package and assembling. I can still hear sand inside the steal of the wagon as well. Parts are missing! I was short washers and lock nuts. Oh and unlike the picture shows, you certainly cannot move the wagon with the sides down without damaging the tires. So do not load your wagon with the sides down and expect to go anywhere without first removing the sides.
customer_reviews.author: PRC

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!
customer_reviews.text: Giving five stars for its trial run. Hubby assembled with no real issues and took our 3 and 9 year old of a rest ride around the house and driveway. Held up great and no complaints from the kids! Will update review with any additional pros/cons after we take it to the swap meet/car show event we intended to use it for when we bought it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Elisha D

product_meta.title: Sandusky Lee CW3418 Muscle Carts Steel Utility Garden Wagon, 400 lb. Load Capacity, 21-3/4" Height x 34" Length x 18" Width
product_meta.description: This Muscle Carts garden wagon has a 400 lb. load capacity, is made of steel, and comes with folding, removable sides for flatbed use. The utility wagon is designed for transporting up to 400 lb. of supplies, equipment, or materials. The crate's steel mesh construction provides increased rust resistance over iron, and has a powder-coated finish for durability. To facilitate loading and unloading of heavy items from the wagon, the sides of the crate fold down, and can be removed entirely for flatbed wagon applications, such as transporting oversized articles. The wagon comes with a steel handle with a D-style grip, and four 10" pneumatic rubber tires to resist abrasion and absorb shock while rolling on assorted indoor and outdoor terrain. The wagon is 21-3/4 x 34 x 18 inches (H x L x W). (H is height, the vertical distance from lowest to highest point; L is length, the horizontal distance from front to back; W is width, the horizontal distance from left to right.) With the sides removed, the utility wagon's height is 13-1/2". This wagon requires some assembly (tools sold separately), and it is suitable for material handling applications in gardens, warehouses, construction sites, and stores, among others. Utility wagons, also known as service carts, are used for securely storing, organizing, and transporting equipment, supplies, refuse, and materials. They are suitable for use in industrial, manufacturing, and maintenance applications, as well as in the home. Sandusky Lee manufactures steel storage products for office, commercial, industrial, and educational applications.
feature_bullets: Crate wagon for transporting up to 400 lb. of supplies, equipment, and materials
Steel mesh crate with powder-coated finish for durability and corrosion resistance
Crate sides fold down or remove for flatbed use with oversized loads
D-style handle for pulling the wagon
Four 10" pneumatic rubber tires for use outdoors and on most flooring types

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
